channel.title: CVE Feed for chatwoot -- chatwoot/chatwoot
channel.description: The latest CVEs for chatwoot -- chatwoot/chatwoot

item.title: CVE-2022-2901|2024-08-03T00:53:00.430Z -- chatwoot -- chatwoot%2Fchatwoot
item.description: Improper Authorization in GitHub repository chatwoot/chatwoot prior to 2.8.

item.title: CVE-2021-3813|2024-08-03T17:09:08.818Z -- chatwoot -- chatwoot%2Fchatwoot
item.description: Improper Privilege Management in GitHub repository chatwoot/chatwoot prior to v2.2.

item.title: CVE-2021-3649|2024-08-03T17:01:07.709Z -- chatwoot -- chatwoot%2Fchatwoot
item.description: chatwoot is vulnerable to Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

item.title: CVE-2022-3741|2024-08-03T01:20:57.602Z -- chatwoot -- chatwoot%2Fchatwoot
item.description: Impact varies for each individual vulnerability in the application. For generation of accounts, it may be possible, depending on the amount of system resources available, to create a DoS event in the server. These accounts still need to be activated; however, it is possible to identify the output Status Code to separate accounts that are generated and waiting for email verification. \n\nFor the sign in directories, it is possible to brute force login attempts to either login portal, which could lead to account compromise.
